page.title: 02Cup and Ring Marks,Morwick.
page.content: Cup and ring carvings on rocks are found in many places in North Northumberland.They date from almost 1600BC.Several carvings can be seen on the sandstone cliffs alongside the River Coquet at Morwick.The carvings take the form of spirals,sometimes linked together,and cup and ring designs.The carved symbols appear to have a religious origin and were probably associated with burial customs because they are usually near burial sites. The site at Morwick is difficult to reach and it must have been just as difficult for the people who did the carvings. The sandstone is soft but these strange patterns were carved out with the use of very simple tools eg.a piece of sharpened harder rock.Each of the carvings has a diameter of about 30 cms.
